channel.title: Deploy Flow :: My Hugo Site
channel.description: Table of Contents This section provides step-by-step guidance for deploying both Frontend and Backend components onto the cloud infrastructure. It covers the complete deployment workflow, from build artifacts preparation to production-ready release on AWS services. 5.3.1. Frontend Deploy Guidelines for building, configuring, and deploying the frontend to Amazon S3 + CloudFront with cross-region failover. 5.3.2. Backend Deploy Instructions for deploying backend microservices to AWS ECS/Fargate, including network configuration, load balancing, and service integration.

item.title: Frontend Deploy
item.description: Architectural model Domain: Route 53 (DNS) + ACM (SSL Certificate). CDN: CloudFront (Global Edge Network). Storage (Primary): S3 Singapore (ap-southeast-1). Storage (Failover): S3 N. Virginia (us-east-1). Replication: Automatically copy code from Singapore -> Virginia. Security: OAC (Origin Access Control) - Private Bucket. Table of Contents Prerequisites S3 and Replication Route 53 and ACM ClouFront and Failover S3 Policy DNS Record Deploy and Test

item.title: Backend Deploy
item.description: Architecture Model This model illustrates the core services used for high-availability, low-latency content delivery and security: Domain & SSL: Route 53 (DNS) is used for domain management, and ACM (SSL Certificate) secures the traffic. CDN: CloudFront acts as the Global Edge Network for content delivery. Storage (Primary): S3 in Singapore (ap-southeast-1) holds the main static assets. Storage (Failover): S3 in N. Virginia (us-east-1) serves as the secondary storage location. Replication: Automated replication copies files from Singapore to Virginia for redundancy.
